title: Angular momentum - use L-t graph to compare torque

content.question: A sphere is initially at rest and starts spinning about a fixed axis through its center. The graph shows the sphereâ€™s angular momentum <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>. For which time interval, <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="3 seconds is less than t, which is less than 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>, is the net torque exerted on the sphere greater in magnitude? What feature of the graph supports the claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. The slope of the graph is less than the slope during <math alttext="3 seconds is less than t, which is less than 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. The value of <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> changes by more than it does during <math alttext="3 seconds is less than t, which is less than 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="3 seconds is less than t, which is less than 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. The slope of the graph is greater than the slope during <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="3 seconds is less than t, which is less than 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. The value of <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> changes by less than it does during <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="3 seconds is less than t, which is less than 4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. The slope of the graph is greater than the slope during <math alttext="0 seconds is less than t, which is less than 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
